Name: lithium iron phosphate production, hydrothermal process | lithium iron phosphate | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description: ;Lithium iron phosphate can be produced via hydrothermal process or solid state process. The hydrothermal process requires the use of reactants such as lithium hydroxide, phosphoric acid and iron sulfate, and heating of water in addition to the reactants. ;;The general reaction is the following: ;3LiOH(aq) + H3PO4(aq) + FeSO4(aq) --> LiFePO4(s) + Li2SO4(aq) + 3H2O;Reference: ;;Dunn, J., James, C., Gaines, L., & Gallagher, K. (2014). Material and energy flow in the production of cathode and anode materials for lithium ion batteries. Argonne National Laboratory.
